habits: Non-smoker, no alcohol consumption, moderate physical activity
medicalHistory: Hypothyroidism (diagnosed 5 years ago, managed with levothyroxine)
familyHistory:
Mother: Breast cancer (diagnosed at age 50, survived)
- Paternal grandmother: Ovarian cancer
previousDiagnoses: Stage 1 Invasive Ductal Carcinoma (diagnosed 8 months ago, treated with lumpectomy and radiation)
currentSymptoms:
- New lump in the breast (increased in size over the last month)
- Mild pain in the breast (persistent)
- Occasional skin changes around the breast (redness and dimpling)

testData: New mass detected near the lumpectomy site (recent finding)
Enlarged lymph nodes near the breast (recent finding)
Estrogen receptor positive, progesterone receptor negative (recent result)

clinicalNotes: Entry 1: April 5, 2024  Chief Complaint: New lump in the breast and mild pain. History: Patient reports discovering a new lump in the breast, with pain increasing over the past month. No fever or other systemic symptoms. Examination: Lump palpable at the site of previous surgery, mild tenderness. Assessment: Possible recurrence of breast cancer. Plan: Imaging and biopsy of new mass, referral to oncology for further management.

Entry 2: April 20, 2024  Chief Complaint: Increasing breast pain. History: Patient reports the lump has increased in size and pain is becoming more persistent. No signs of infection or discharge. Examination: Mass palpable, hard, and irregular in shape. Assessment: Likely recurrence of breast cancer at the site of previous surgery. Plan: Surgical biopsy, plan for staging if positive, start chemotherapy.

Entry 3: May 1, 2024  Chief Complaint: Lump progression and skin changes. History: Patient reports worsening of symptoms, with visible skin changes (redness and dimpling). Examination: Firm mass, enlarged lymph nodes under the arm. Assessment: Progression to stage 2 breast cancer, increased tumor size and lymph node involvement. Plan: Chemotherapy initiation, surgery for lymph node evaluation, follow-up in 2 weeks.
otherInfo:
- No history of other cancers
- No smoking or alcohol use
